MainActivity.java:
public class MainActivity extends ActionBarActivity {
    @Override
    protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
        super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
        setContentView(R.layout.activity_main);
        View rootView = findViewById(android.R.id.content);
        new Something(rootView);
    }

Something.java:
import android.view.View;
import android.widget.EditText;
import android.widget.Button;

public class Something {
    private View rootView;
    private Button add, subtract, multiply, divide;
    private EditText editA, editB, editC;
    private double doubleA, doubleB, doubleC;

    public Something(View rootView) {
        this.rootView = rootView;
        click();
    }

    public void click() {
        editA = (EditText) rootView.findViewById(R.id.editText);
        editB = (EditText) rootView.findViewById(R.id.editText2);
        editC = (EditText) rootView.findViewById(R.id.editText3);
        doubleA = Double.parseDouble(editA.getText().toString());
        doubleB = Double.parseDouble(editB.getText().toString());

        add = (Button) rootView.findViewById(R.id.add);
        subtract = (Button) rootView.findViewById(R.id.subtract);
        multiply = (Button) rootView.findViewById(R.id.multiply);
        divide = (Button) rootView.findViewById(R.id.divide);

        add.setOnClickListener(new View.OnClickListener() {
            @Override
            public void onClick(View v) {
                doubleC = doubleA + doubleB;
                String s = "" + doubleC;
                editC.setText(s);
            }
        });

        subtract.setOnClickListener(new View.OnClickListener() {
            @Override
            public void onClick(View v) {
                doubleC = doubleA - doubleB;
                String s = "" + doubleC;
                editC.setText(s);
            }
        });

        multiply.setOnClickListener(new View.OnClickListener() {
            @Override
            public void onClick(View v) {
                doubleC = doubleA * doubleB;
                String s = "" + doubleC;
                editC.setText(s);
            }
        });

        divide.setOnClickListener(new View.OnClickListener() {
            @Override
            public void onClick(View v) {
                doubleC = doubleA / doubleB;
                String s = "" + doubleC;
                editC.setText(s);
            }
        });
    }
}

<<<explanation>>>: The issue was that the Something class was trying to find views using the Activity's findViewById method, but the views were actually part of the activity's layout. By passing the root view of the activity layout to the Something class, you can use the rootView.findViewById method to find the views.
